_header: Loved be thou king and thanked be thou king
Note:
Cf. a Levacion prayer in Lay Folks’ Mass Book (5537), lines 427-35, pr. Horstmann (1895)
XHorstmann, Carl. Yorkshire Writers. 2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96 2.6. For second song see 6482
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Ff.5.45: not in this MS; Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Hh.1.12: not in this MS; Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Ii.4.9: text ff. 190-197 similar to Rolle’s Form, but varies considerably; Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Ii.6.55: this copy of Form of Living begins imperfectly in chapter x; Manchester, Chetham’s Library 6691 [Mun.A.7.1]: not in this MS; Dublin, Trinity College, Dublin 155: not in this MS; Oxford, Bodleian Library Eng. poet. a.1 (SC 3938) [Vernon MS]: Form of Perfect Living ff. 334ra -338ra but does not include this verse; HM127 ; London, British Library Egerton 3245 [olim Gurney]: not in this MS; London, British Library Harley 1022: not in this MS
